item.title: Introducing Our Returning Athletes!

item.title: Stem Cell Drive
item.description: Trick-or-treat yourself to a good deed🎃👻 Join us on OCTOBER 30th for our Halloween Stem Cell Drive — one small swab can mean a lifetime for someone else🧬 Pop by for some information on stem cells and Halloween treats!

item.title: What Were You Wearing?
item.description: Stop by this powerful exhibit hosted by the Sexual Violence Prevention and Respond Office on Wednesday and Thursday next week!

item.title: Do Muslims Celebrate Halloween?
item.description:
Assalamualaikum WarahmatAllahi Wabarakahtuhu everyone!
📣 Join us this Thursday at the B2 Atrium, 11:30 AM - 3:00 PM for an engaging discussion on, “Do Muslims celebrate Halloween?”
Come by our booth to learn more, ask questions, and enjoy FREE hot chocolate and marshmallows! ☕🍫
We look forward to seeing you there!

item.description:

All supplies + refreshments are provided, just bring yourself and your creativity ❤️🔥 🗓️Thursday, October 30th ⏰4:30pm - 6:30pm 📍EXP 1686 ✅ No registration required - all students welcome!

item.title: Online Info Session
item.description:
We are excited to announce that UW Global Dental Brigades will be going to Greece in April 2026! 🇬🇷🦷
Are you curious about how to gain hands on experience in the dental field? Want to contribute to global dental health and have a once in a lifetime experience? Come to our information session to learn about our mission and how YOU can join us in a Greece to make a change.
📅: Thursday, October 30, 2025 ⏰: 5:00 pm 📍: Online (link will be in our bio before the event)
All are welcome to join and we will be bringing 20 volunteers so be sure to secure your spot TODAY!

item.title: Halloween Practice + Pumpkin Painting
item.description: 👻 Halloween practice + pumpkin painting night! 🎃 Come paddle and paint with us this Halloween! 🧛‍♀️ Costume Practice: Oct 30 | 5:30–7 PM | Warrior Zone 🎨 Pumpkin Painting: 7:30–9 PM | MC 4021 For pumpkin painting, send $10 to katie.g.quigley@gmail.com by Oct 27 @ 7 PM so we can get you a pumpkin! All materials will be provided! Pumpkin painting is open to all — bring your friends #halloween #uwbdc #pumpkinpainting

item.description:

Join us for: 🧡pizza 🖤costume contest 🧡Halloween jigsaw puzzle 🖤 Headbandz 🧡Halloween mini games
There will be great prizes, great company and lots of Halloween fun! Sign up through link in bio:))

item.title: Prof Night
item.description: It’s almost PROF NIGHT TIMEEEEEEE! Join us on Thursday, October 30th from 6-9 PM at Huether Hotel (with CGSS AND BSA) for some pool, yapping with friends and profs, and some amazing food and drinks 🎃🍻 Since it’ll be around Halloween, put on a costume! (maybe even dress up as the orgo midterm or a Crowdmark notification, truly nothing scarier than that) 😱 See you there (or else.... 👻)!

item.title: Pumpkin Carving
item.description:
🎃 Pumpkinn & Thrill: A Spooky Carving Night! 👻
Get ready for a night of creativity and chills as we carve our way into Halloween! ✨ Join us on October 30th from 6–8 PM for a pumpkin carving event with a thrilling twist. 🎨🕸️
Come dressed in your Halloweenest costume 🧛‍♀️🧙‍♂️ and show off your carving skills (or just your spooky vibes)! Whether you’re a pro with the carving knife or a first-time pumpkin artist, this event is open to all! 🙌
🕕 Date & Time: October 30th @ 6–8 PM 📍 Location: SLC Lower Flex Hall
🎃 Disclaimer: Pumpkins and carving tools are available while supplies last, so make sure to arrive early! ⏰
🔗 Click the link in our bio to learn more — and get ready for a night full of pumpkins, costumes, and thrills! 💀✨

item.title: Meeting
item.description: Don’t miss our next meeting! Thursday at 6pm, expect rounds of 3x3 and Megaminx. We hope to see you all there!

item.title: Discussion Night
item.description:
We are excited to announce our next event of the term, a philosophy discussion night in collaboration with the Wilfrid Laurier University Philosophy Club! The event will begin at 6pm with 30 minutes of philosophy themed games and icebreakers. From 6:30-8:30pm, we will break into groups to discuss philosophy questions.
The event is open to everyone of all majors/experience levels, and all topics or terminology will be briefly explained before each discussion begins to ensure everyone is on the same page.
WHEN: Thursday, October 30th 6pm-8:30pm WHERE: Laurier Campus, ARTS 2C17 (Arts C wing C)
As the discussion night will be held at Laurier University, we will post detailed instructions for how to get there before the event. The WLU interactive map can be found in our linktree.
If you would like to submit a discussion topic question ahead of time, you can do so through the form in our linktree.
We hope to see you there!

item.title: Murder Mystery Dinner
item.description: Hey ENV! Join ESS for an amazing night of food, fun, and thrilling riddles at our annual murder mystery dinner in the EV3 atrium on October 30th. It's free for ENV students and dinner will be provided! Non-ENV students are welcome to join as well! 🎃 To register, visit the link in our Linktree.

item.description: Trick or treat yourself to a cozy game night with @soch_uwaterloo 🎲🎃🍬 Come hang with us before Halloween with free hot chocolate and candy! #southasianmentalhealth #halloween

item.description: 📣 Assalamu Alaykum MSA! Join us for our upcoming education event where Ustadh Basim Salim will be discussing the topic of Istikhara. You don’t want to miss this one! 🫵 Food will be served. Sign up is required- use the link in our bio!

item.title: Retro Night
item.description: This week we are featuring Mario Kart Double Dash in addition to our usual offering of Mario Kart 8 and World. If you want to try out this black sheep of the Mario kart franchise, come on out this Thursday, October 30th, 7pm @ MC2065

item.title: Escape Room
item.description:
ready to get into the halloween spirit? 🎃👻
DSC’s first-ever ESCAPE ROOM is here– spooky puzzles, snacks, and prizes await… 😈🧩
🗓️ October 30 | 7–9PM 📍 starts in MC 2066 💻 bring your laptop!
there will be snacks, candy, cookies, and prizes for the winning team 😋🍪🏆
👥 teams of 3–4 (no worries if you don’t have one yet– you can form one at the event!) 💸 all participants must be DSC members (membership can be paid at the start!)
so grab your friends, solve some puzzles, and see if you can escape before the time runs out!!!⏳🙈
rsvp form in our linktree 🔗

item.title: The Final Girl Games
item.description:
Come join WaterBoo! and UW Movie Watchers Club this Thursday at 7 for our Halloween collab 👻 After 14 rounds of voting for the best horror movie featuring a female lead, the time has finally come to decide on the best final girl. Come prepared to defend your favourite of the two final films (Alien and You’re Next), vote, and watch the winning one 🎃
Snacks will be provided. See you there!

item.title: Halloween Climb
item.description: 🎃 Halloween Climb is here! 👻 Join us next week on Thursday, October 30 for a night of fun costumes, and free candy while you crush some frightfully fun problems at GRRW’s Boulder Night! If you bring a costume, you might get featured in our recap video 👀 Did we mention free candy? That’s there too! Please note that the GRR and PAC meetups are switched next week! PAC on Wednesday 7:30-9:00 PM and GRRW on Thursday from 7:00-9:00 PM

item.title: Halloween Game Night
item.description: 🧛‍♀️ Trick or treat yourself to a night full of KPOP chaos, games, and candy 🍬 When? 🕖 Oct 30th | 7-9 PM. Where? 📍MC 4041 We'll have snacks, prizes and even a costume contest (👀) available!! Come by with your friends, roommates, and your best costume 🕴️

item.title: Praise & Prayer
item.description: Come join us on Thursday, Oct 30 for a time of prayer and worship alongside friends from Grebel! We will be meeting in AL 105 from 7-8pm. We hope to see you there!

item.title: Bible Study
item.description: Since we live by the Spirit, let us keep in step with the Spirit.” — Galatians 5:25 NIV Join us next Thursday (October 30th, 2025) for an evening of reflection and renewal. Together we will explore what it means to truly know the Holy Spirit and walk in alignment with God’s will as youth. Through scripture, discussion, and fellowship, we will learn to follow His guidance in every step of our journey!

item.title: Japanese Language Learning Session
item.description: Our Fall 2025 language session schedule is here! 🌟 Check the calendar to find out when your favourite sessions are running. A few sessions are still TBD, so stay tuned on discord for updates. We’re also still recruiting tutors for certain languages – details on the poster! 🗣️ Apply through our linktree if interested 🔗

item.title: Guitar Workshop
item.description: JAMNETWORKIANS! Ever wanted to learn how to play the guitar? Or are you an intermediate player looking to advance your skills? IF SO, you should come to our guitar workshops happening this October 30th (Thursday)! Don’t worry about not having a guitar, because WE are providing a variety of guitars to play on to all those who attend 🎸 We will be having three types of guitar workshop stations ongoing starting at 8:00 :) This is a free event with no sign up required! 🔥 🎶 Feel free to bring your own guitar if you have one. ➡️ Beginner Station (Teachers: Brandon and Arayansh) Are you a beginner guitar player, and are looking to learn basic chords so you can play along to your favourite songs? Well, the beginner station is for you! At the beginner station lead by Brandon and Arayansh, you will learn basic strumming patterns, chords and playing technique in order to play your favourite songs! ➡️ Riff Creation Station (Teacher: Camilo) Do you want to make your own catchy melodies and SOLOS!!?? Well then the riff creation station is for you :) Camilo will teach you about creating your own melodies on top of chord progressions, lead guitar techniques, and other soloing tips! ➡️ Scale Station (Teacher: Matt) Do you want to understand what you’re actually playing? Familarize yourself with patterns in the songs that you love? Check out the scale station where you will learn more scales than fish have... Use these shapes for solos, melodies, etc! You do not have to be an advanced guitar player for any of these stations! Just come with a willingness to learn!

item.title: Raa Raa — Halloween Bash
item.description: Join us for Raa Raa Halloween Bash on Oct 30 at Dallas Nightclub, Kitchener. Registration required, $20 entry!

item.description:

item.description: The tobacco in the sky garden has been growing all summer and is ready to be harvested!

item.description: For our PHYS10 Halloween seminar, we have Dr. Matthew Robbins from the University of Toronto coming by to talk about the Applications of Quantum Mechanics! ⚛️ Light refreshments and Halloween treats will be provided! 👻🎃

item.description:
~ Theme of the Week: Halloween Week - Spooky Sparring and Self Defense
Hello everyone! In the spirit of Halloween this week, we’ll be focusing on sparring and self-defense techniques to help keep you safe during this spooky time of year! All classes will be running normally as scheduled, and we hope to see you there!

item.title: Halloween Open Mic
item.description: Still itching to perform after album concert JAMNET?? 🎶 Come perform or watch our Halloween Open Mic in collaboration with Waterboo happening this FRIDAY, 6PM at Studio 180 in Hagey Hall!! ALL are invited, purely drop-in :) ➡️ Please note that no shoes are allowed in Studio 180 (but pls wear socks)❤️ The open mic will also end at 9:00PM! 🎺🎹Looking to perform this open mic? We will have drumkit, mics, guitar, piano and bass all set up for you! Just bring yourself or your band and sign up at the door!! (Or feel free to bring your own if you have :)) There will be a costume contest as well! Come for the music, stay for the people!! Hope to see you there :)

item.title: UWOrbital's Halloween Event
item.description: Hello UWOrbital members! Join us this Friday for a Halloween treat 🎃 See if you can beat the leads in some festive games‼️Costumes are encouraged and we look forward to seeing you all there.

item.description:

item.title: Halloween Dinner + Karaoke

🎃Hallween Dinner + Karaoke🎃 Get ready for a spooky night filled with dinner, music, and scares!! 👻🎤

item.title: World Series Watch Party
item.description:
⚾ Blue Jays vs. Dodgers World Series Watch Parties! ⚾
The Toronto Blue Jays are taking on the LA Dodgers in the World Series — and we’re bringing every game to campus on the big screen! 💥
📅 Game Dates:
Oct 24 • Oct 25 • Oct 27 • Oct 28 🕗 8 PM 📍 SLC Great Hall
💙 Show up in your blue + white or Blue Jays gear and help fill the Great Hall with team spirit!
Grab your friends, bring the hype, and get ready for an unforgettable week of baseball, big plays, and campus energy! 🔥
Link in bio for details.

item.title: UWDC x Origins Combo Collab
item.description:
Get ready for one of our most epic collabs yet! UW Dance Company x Origins is bringing you two back-to-back combo classes on Saturday, November 1st from 4:00 pm–7:00pm in PAC Studio 1! Join us for an Open combo with Kelsey from UWDC and a Hip Hop combo with Mikayla from Origins. 🤩🔥
Everyone is welcome! Fill out the pre-registration form linked in our bio to register before the start of class 🕺$15 for non-members and $10 for team members.
Don’t miss this amazing collab! We can’t wait to see you there! 💛🖤🧡 #dance #dancersofinsta #explore #uwaterloo #uwdancecompany #originsdancecompany

Show up in cosplay for a free drink 🍹 Event is free entry! 📆 November 1, 2025 ⏰ 6pm 📍STC 1123 (former Bombshelter Pub) And a big thanks to @sharpenyourforks for the lovely poster art 🥰

item.title: TEDxUW 2025 Conference
item.description:
TEDxUW 2025 CONFERENCE — hosted by TEDxUW
🗓️ November 2 @ 1:00PM - 6:00PM 📍 University of Waterloo Humanities Theatre
Ready to rethink the world around you? Join TEDxUW for an afternoon of bold ideas, inspiring talks, and fresh perspectives from the Waterloo community and beyond. This year’s theme, Everything Reimagined, challenges you to question the norm, spark new conversations, and imagine what’s possible.
Get tickets now on TEDxUW’s page.

item.title: HER Network Event
item.description:
Going into public or global health? Join HER Network’s interactive panel event—created by and for women starting their careers in health.
💬 Hear from recent grads who’ve landed their first roles 🤝 Connect in small breakout rooms for Q&A + networking 🌍 Build your confidence and community in the field
📅 Sun, Nov 02 | 2:00-4:00 PM | Virtual on Zoom
Register now in our bio for your ticket & a chance to win a free one-year membership!

item.title: Slime Time
item.description:

item.title: Fall 2025 League
item.description: Sign up now for our Fall 2025 League! 6 weeks of curling, all skill levels welcome! Membership is $90. Use the link in our bio to fill out the Google Form and Sign Up on Athletics (2 forms to fill out).

item.title: Board Game Night
item.description: Midterm season’s been tough — you’ve worked hard and deserve a break! UWTSS is here to help you unwind with a cozy night of games and good vibes Roll in for a chill night of boards, cards, and new friends! 🗓 Nov 2 | 6:30–9:30 PM 📍 Location: DWE 3522 Members get one free drink and a bag of chips 🍹🍟 Drinks and chips will also be available for purchase! ✌️NO TICKETS NEEDED✌️ Swipe to see the games and get ready for our mystery tournament 👀🎁 Come laugh, play, and recharge before the next round of deadlines hits! 💫

item.description:

Each team member needs to register using the form linked in our bio! Teams can consist of 1-4 people.

item.title: Patient Perspective Talk
item.description: Join us as Mr. Lowden shares his inspiring story of perseverance and adaptation in the face of progressive vision loss. Born with high myopia and became monocular at age 18 after a giant retinal tear. Experiencing a recent decline in detail vision, including acuity and contrast sensitivity. Relies on a range of low vision devices, which he will demonstrate during his talk.

item.title: Finding the Balance in Sustainable Menstruation
item.description:
🌍 Sustainability goes beyond recycling bins; it's also about how we care for our bodies and communities.
Join us in exploring how sustainability, period poverty, and menstrual equity intersect in the next installment of the Menstrual Equity Series, "Finding the Balance in Sustainable Menstruation"!
💡Hosted by Karen Farley (they/their) Environmental researcher and recent master's graduate, Karen's findings led to the creation of "Period Pin", an online map connecting menstruators to over 2,000 product locations across Canada.
**Registration link in bio
📆 Tuesday, November 4th! 📍Online

item.title: WiE Career Fair
item.description: Join the WiE Career Fair on Nov 4, 2025, at SLC Black and Gold Room. Free registration required!

item.title: Alum Spotlight Q&A: Tom Miller
item.description:
🌟 Alum Spotlight Q&A: Tom Miller 🌟
Curious about where an ActSci degree can take you beyond the traditional path? Meet Tom Miller — a UW alum who started as an actuary, earned his FSA in 2019, pivoted into consulting, and now works at a startup using data to tackle the addiction crisis. Tom’s career spans technical modeling, client-facing strategy work, and mission-driven product building, and he’s excited to talk candidly about what he’s learned along the way.
📍 MC 4041 📅 Nov 4 🕔 5:00 – 7:00 PM
What you’ll get from this session: * How to leverage actuarial skills to move into consulting and startups * What earning the FSA opened up—and what it didn’t * Day-to-day realities of non-traditional actuarial roles * Practical advice on courses, co-op choices, and storytelling on your resume * Open Q&A—ask anything!
All years welcome—whether you’re exploring career options, planning a pivot, or just want inspiration from someone who’s done it.

item.title: Applying Mathematical Models to Vaccination and Epidemiology
item.description:
Our first AMATH Prof Talk of the term is coming up soon!
Title: Applying Mathematical Models to Vaccination and Epidemiology Speaker: Prof. Chris Bauch Abstract: Vaccine refusal has enabled previously eliminated infectious diseases--such as measles and pertussis--to re-emerge in many populations. Vaccine refusal is driven by many factors, one of which is the presence or absence of the infectious disease that the vaccine itself prevents. This suggests that disease spread and vaccine decision-making are, in fact, two parts of a single coupled system of behaviour-disease interactions. Mathematical models have a long history of application in the population biology of human pathogens, including pediatric infectious diseases, and they are increasingly applied to coupled behaviour-disease interactions as well. In this talk I will give an overview of some simple mathematical models of vaccine refusal for pediatric infectious diseases, including a discussion of what they predict and how well they match up with observational data. I will also discuss extensions of these models to the COVID pandemic.
Pizza and refreshments available for PMC members.

item.title: Accessibility Design Workshop
item.description:
Making designing accessible for all 🤝
UW/UX is hosting an Accessibility Design Workshop! Come on out and be ready to create, experiment, and learn! This is truly an event you do not want to miss out on!

item.title: United Voices: A National Meet & Greet for Black Academic Organizations
item.description:
Join us for ‘United Voices: A National Meet & Greet for Black Academic Organizations’, a virtual gathering designed to bring together Black-led associations, faculty, staff, students, and institutional partners across Canadian higher education.
Through this session, we aim to:
- Build stronger connections between Black organizations in academia - Share best practices, challenges, and successes - Explore opportunities for collaboration and advocacy - Celebrate Blackness in Canadian higher education
Register to join: bit.ly/BCSAUnitedVoices
This event is hosted by the Black Canadian Studies Association (BCSA) and the Office of Equity, Diversity, Inclusion & Anti-Racism (EDI-R).

item.title: Law and Economics: Rational and Objective or Fundamentally Unjust?
item.description:
We are happy to announce our Philosophy Talk of the term presented by Professor Patricia Marino, Law and economics: rational and objective or fundamentally unjust?
WHEN: Wednesday November 5th at 5pm WHERE: Hagey Hall Room 345 DESCRIPTION: Law and economics is the application of economic theory to legal reasoning: in this increasingly influential approach, laws are understood not in terms of justice and rights, but rather as efficient solutions to the problems of organizing society. In normative law and economics, the aim of the legal system is to maximize social welfare. Normative law and economics thus echoes the ethical theory of utilitarianism, where the right action is the one that produces the best consequences. Like utilitarianism, law and economics reasoning faces challenges to do with ethical values such as justice, fairness, and equality: what if the best consequences sacrifice some people's interests for the good of others, increase inequality, or violate other ethical norms? In this talk, I showcase these problems through examples related to tax policy, environmental injustice, and health care resource allocation; I then explain how proponents of law and economics respond to these challenges. We can then discuss together whether law and economics is a rational, objective alternative to arbitrary decision-making or whether its recommendations can be fundamentally unjust.
Snacks and drinks will be provided. This talk is open to all members of the UW community, no experience or expertise in philosophy required. We hope to see you there for an interesting philosophy talk and discussion on philosophy of economics!

item.title: 3Peas: Performative Edition
item.description:
🍵 3Peas: Performative Edition 🎧
It’s time to romanticize volleyball. ✨ Join us for our Performative 3Peas Tournament on Friday, November 7th, where we’ll be serving performative energy both on and off the court. 🏐
📆 Date: Friday, November 7 ⏰ Time: 3:00 PM – 9:00 PM 🏫 Location: CIF Gyms 1 & 2 🎭 Theme: Performative 🎶 🏅 Prizes: Winning team of 6 + Best Dressed Team
👥 Sign up as: • A team of 3 (female-identifying members) • Or as an individual and get matched with a team!
✨ Tournament Divisions & Caps: • Level 1/2/3 Tournament: Level cap of 7 • Level 3/4/5 Tournament: Level cap of 12 • All competitors must be evaluated this term in Levels 1–5 • These are two separate women’s tournaments (Level 1/2/3 and Level 3/4/5)
🏐 Format: • Round Robins: Each trio plays 5–6 sets, randomly paired against other trios. • Finals: Top 2 teams (by sets won then point differential) each choose another trio to play with for finals.
👉 Sign-ups open this Friday at 3 PM — first come, first serve! Wait for your captain’s confirmation email before game day. 📍 Link in our Linktree!
So grab your tote, sip your matcha, open up Clash Royale, and get ready to soft-serve your heart out. ☁️🍵💿

item.title: Crown Conversations
item.description: Hi family! 👋🏾 Join BASE, LBIH (Lanterna Black Innovation Hub) and the Black Collective for “Crown Conversations”, a collaboration with their “Friday’s After 5”sessions at the EDI-R. We’ll be talking about everything to do with Black hair and belonging. Topics will include: hair-typing and its origins, texturism within the Black community, hair styling and products, plus a discussion to share personal journeys and routines! 🗓️ Friday, November 7th, 2025 ⏱️ 5-7:30 PM 📍East Campus 5 (EC5) -> Second floor -> Office of Equity, Diversity, Inclusion and Anti-Racism (EDI-R) 🍕 There will be pizza and other light refreshments available. See you soon!

item.title: Badminton Ontario Circuit Tryouts
item.description:
BADMINTON ONTARIO CIRCUIT TRYOUTS ‼️ 🗓️ We’ll be hosting tryouts for our circuit team in two weeks, on Friday, November 7th, from 9:30 PM - 12:30 AM, during regular session. This is SEPARATE from varsity’s team.
‼️YOU MUST BE A UWBC MEMBER TO PARTICIPATE (unless otherwise stated by the team)
✍️ Applicants must fill out the registration form and will be required to pay a tryout fee of $5.
👟 It is HIGHLY recommended to bring running shoes, along with your court shoes.
🏃‍♂️‍➡️ The first part of the tryout will be an outdoor run.
CIRCUIT INFORMATION 🏆 Badminton Ontario’s new circuit aims to give university club players the opportunity to represent their school while playing high-level, competitive badminton.
🏅 This circuit will feature four tournaments, at the following locations: 1. Brock University (St. Catharines) 2. University of Waterloo (Waterloo) 3. University of Toronto (Scarborough) 4. Pan-Am Centre (Markham)
🏸 Each of these tournaments will feature 5 events: - MS - WS - MD - WD - XD
👯 As such, we’re aiming to take a maximum of 16 players. (8 men, 8 women).
🧑‍🧒 We will also be taking subs based on term/individual availabilities and injuries.
✅ Thanks, and I hope to see you all at tryouts!
🍀 Best of luck!

item.title: Tabletop Tavern
item.description:
Tabletop Tavern is here for its 5th running and we are back and better than ever! Sponsored by J&J Cards and Collectables & Ravenwood Tabletop, expect this now six-way collab event in SLC 1123 (The Bomber) Sat, Nov. 8th from 12-11pm between UW Board Games Club, WATSFiC, Deceptions Board Games, Pokémon Club, Yu-Gi-Oh Club, and the Magic the Gathering Club to be a day you don’t want to miss!
Come for a day of scheduled events, live performances, a raffle for prizes (sponsored by J&J’s and Ravenwood), a drinks bar (non-alcoholic), snacks, for-loan games (given you provide your WATCard or Valid ID), items for sale, and so much more!
For each scheduled event you take part in you will get a raffle ticket for a chance to win amazing sponsored prizes at the end of the night! The winners of WATSFiC’s D&D tournament get an additional ticket towards the raffle. To sign-up for WATSFiC’s tournament and guarantee a seat, please see their discord server posts. Walk-in is also available. Any volunteer DMs will also get a free drink from our drinks bar for your efforts!
Again, a big thanks to @jjcardsandcollectibles and @ravenwoodtabletop.ca for agreeing to sponsor the event and offer our raffle prizes, @acornpeanuts for the front poster design, @daidd_an for the rest of the poster designs, and to all the organizing clubs (@uwboardgames @uwdeception @uwyugioh @uwatsfic @uw_pokemon_club and Magic the Gathering) for working so hard to put this all together. We couldn’t have done it without you!
So with that being said, we hope to see you at Tabletop Tavern this term as we get back into the full swing of things! Check each club’s Discord server announcements for more details. If you want to keep up with each club, don’t hesitate to check out what they have coming up after and/or leading up to Tabletop Tavern!

See you there! 💃🕺

item.title: Winter Wonderland
item.description: ❄️💫 The ASU 2025 Semi-Formal is happening under the magical sparkle of the snowflakes and glimmer of the moonlight ✨ Dress in your finest clothes and join us for an amazing evening 🪩🥂 On November 15th from 7 pm - 12 pm, join your fellow students for an unforgettable night of dancing, food, drinks and good times. 🎟️ Tickets: Non-Arts - $12 Arts Students (that have paid the Arts fee) - FREE Tickets will be on sale soon, stay posted! 🧡

item.title: STANK: Serve's Thanksgiving Annual N(v)olleyball Kompetition
item.description: 🥧 Prepare for a Feast of Fierce Volleyball! 🦃 As the leaves turn and the holiday spirit fills the air, it’s time for STANK: Serve’s Thanksgiving Annual N(v)olleyball Kompetition! Gather your team, bring your best plays, and get ready to serve up gratitude with spikes, digs, and fierce rallies. Let’s celebrate the season with some friendly competition and a full plate of fun! Event Details: 🏐 Date: Saturday, November 15th-16th (Overnight) ⏰ Time: 8pm to 8am 📍 Location: PAC Main Gym + Small Gym 🍂 Team Sign-Up Form your crew of 6 to 9 players (only UWaterloo students with a valid athletics membership or alumni with a day pass) and choose your division: semi-competitive or competitive. Co-ed rules apply: all teams must have at least 2 female-identifying players on the court at all times. (Note: A female libero is required to serve for a middle.) ⚠️ NEW Semi-Comp Sign-Up Rules (Read Carefully!) To keep play balanced and fair this season: - Any male-identifying player rated Level 5 or of Level 5 ability must set or lib on a semi-comp team. - If you attended UW prior to the 5-level system (graduated before Fall 2023), the same rule applies if you were rated Level 4. - Spring levels are not included in this consideration. - If there’s any confusion, please reach out to an exec for clarification. - If your team has a Level 5 male player signed up for semi-comp, contact an exec to verify the validity of your team. - Players who are not evaluated this term may be removed from your team on the day of or asked to set/lib if necessary. 💰 Pricing Regular (still fresh out of the coop): Register by Nov 3rd for $200 Both the form and payment must be completed by Nov 3rd @ 11:59pm. 📝 How to Register Make your payment: https://warrior.uwaterloo.ca/Program/GetProgramDetails?courseId=e7072bd1-0754-4e99-9fbe-04a18228cfe1 Fill out the form: https://forms.office.com/r/twpLDkzmhD @everyone 🏐 Let’s spice up the season, rally together, and make this Thanksgiving one to remember!

item.title: Fall 2025 League
item.description: Sign up now for our Fall 2025 League! 6 weeks of curling, all skill levels welcome! Membership is $90. Use the link in our bio to fill out the Google Form and Sign Up on Athletics (2 forms to fill out).

item.title: Fall 2025 Clinics - Blocking
item.description: Volleyball clinics for UW students! 🏐🔥 Want a safe space to improve specific skills like setting and defence?💪 Then come to our next skills clinics! See schedule for details. 🗓️

item.title: From Outages to Ownership
item.description:
From Outages to Ownership: Disaster Recovery, DNS, and Career Journeys in Okta Engineering
Ready to see how a top tech company handles the really big challenges? Join us and our Okta engineers for an evening focused on the critical work that keeps our services running; even when major outages happen. Our Staff Software Engineer will kick off the event with a fascinating technical talk, diving into DNS, redundancy, and disaster recovery based on her real-world experience at Okta. It’s a timely look at how engineering teams build for reliability at scale.
After the deep-dive, you’ll hear from a panel of Engineers from various teams as they share their own career paths, offer a peek into their day-to-day work, and give you practical advice for launching your career. Stick around for our informal networking mixer to connect one-on-one with the team and ask any final questions!
🔗 Link in bio to register

item.title: UX Interview Tips
item.description:
We’re startinggggg… 🎉
UW/UX Office Hours, happening on Tuesdays from 6 PM - 7 PM! We’re bringing fun to Office Hours! Each week, join us on Discord for guided design knowledge sessions, from workshops to sprints to interview prep! 👀
Whether you’re looking to develop your skills in Figma, brainstorm new ideas, or just hang out with fellow designers, we’ve got you! 💪
📆 When and what: Tuesday, Oct. 28 (6 PM - 7 PM) – Beginner Figma Workshop Tuesday, Nov. 11 (6 PM - 7 PM) – Prompt Design Sprints Tuesday, Nov. 25 (6 PM - 7 PM) – UX Interview Tips
🔗 Where: Discord (link in bio!)
Come hang out, learn something new, and grow your design skills with us! 🌟
